alert.note: Alert for Coke; Nolan; Runnels (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 12:03AM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Coke, southwestern Nolan and northwestern Runnels Counties through 1245 AM CST... At 1202 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area around 1210 AM CST. Robert Lee around 1215 AM CST. Bronte around 1225 AM CST. Maverick around 1230 AM CST. Norton around 1235 AM CST. Other locations impacted by this storm include Pumphrey, Wilmeth, Ballinger Lake, Oak Creek Reservoir, The Intersection Of Highway 208 And Ranch Road 2662, The Intersection Of Highway 158 And Ranch Road 2059 and Us-87 Near The Coke-Tom Green County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CST for west central Texas.
